docs.abstract: Originally conceived as a fund-raiser for Joao Silva, “Conflict Zone” — which opens in New York on Friday — has become a collaborative effort to show the humanity in war. The New York show is dedicated to Chris Hondros, who believed in photographing shared human experiences.
docs.snippet: Originally conceived as a fund-raiser for Joao Silva, “Conflict Zone” — which opens in New York on Friday — has become a collaborative effort to show the humanity in war. The New York show is dedicated to Chris Hondros, who believed in...

docs.lead_paragraph: In a column in today's Campaign Stops, Timothy Egan writes:
docs.abstract: The outrage of Republican presidential candidates over a "war on religion" shouldn't distract us from the real possibility of compromise on health care insurance and contraception.
docs.snippet: The outrage of Republican presidential candidates over a "war on religion" shouldn't distract us from the real possibility of compromise on health care insurance and contraception.

docs.abstract: Political news from today's Times, and a look at what's happening in Washington.
docs.snippet: Political news from today's Times, and a look at what's happening in Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: In Today's Times:After sweeping the nominating contests in Colorado, Minnesota and Missouri on Tuesday, Rick Santorum is getting ambitious. Katharine Q. Seelye reports that Mr. Santorum has plans to expand his reinvigorated campaign operation in the hope of becoming the eventual Republican challenger to President Obama, but he faces obstacles, including his rivals' attacks.
docs.abstract: Political news from today's Times, and a look at what's happening in Washington.
docs.snippet: Political news from today's Times, and a look at what's happening in Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: The issue of covering contraceptives in health care plans has Catholic bishops in an uproar. Let’s try to talk through this in a calm, measured manner.
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column contends that uproar by Catholic Church leaders over rule that would require Catholic universities and hospitals to cover contraceptives in their health care plans is fraught with misrepresentation; asserts that all employees deserve equal access to health coverage, regardless of the religious inclinations of their employer.
docs.snippet: The issue of covering contraceptives in health care plans has Catholic bishops in an uproar. Let’s try to talk through this in a calm, measured manner.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Financial advisers recommend that people with substantial assets protect themselves against rare occurrences.

headline.seo: Personal Liability Insurance Is Essential, Advisers Say
headline.main: Umbrella Policies Fill In Some Gaps

docs.abstract: Financial advisers recommend that people with substantial assets protect themselves against rare occurrences with a personal liability policy; such coverage, commonly called an umbrella policy, is the last line of defense against lawsuits; when other insurance has reached its limit, an umbrella policy will pay claims up to the amount covered.
docs.snippet: Financial advisers recommend that people with substantial assets protect themselves against rare occurrences.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to a front-page article and a column by David Brooks.

headline.main: The Debate Over the Birth Control Rule
headline.print_headline: The Debate Over the Birth Control Rule

docs.snippet: Readers respond to a front-page article and a column by David Brooks.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional Republicans stepped into the battle over an Obama administration rule requiring health insurance plans at Catholic universities and charities to offer free birth control.

headline.seo: Boehner Vows to Fight Contraception Rule
headline.main: Birth Control Is Covered, and G.O.P. Vows a Fight
headline.print_headline: Birth Control Is Covered, And G.O.P. Vows a Fight

docs.abstract: Congressional Republicans forcefully enter the battle over an Obama administration rule requiring health insurance plans provided by Catholic universities and charities to offer free birth control to women; vow to fight back with legislation that unravels the policy; many republicans see the issue as a chance to unify their base in an election year.
docs.snippet: Congressional Republicans stepped into the battle over an Obama administration rule requiring health insurance plans at Catholic universities and charities to offer free birth control.

docs.abstract: Catholic hospitals are now claiming a special right to conscience that trumps law.
docs.snippet: Catholic hospitals are now claiming a special right to conscience that trumps law.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the escalating conflict over the new federal requirement that employers include contraception coverage without a co-pay in the insurance plans they make available to their employees, opposition from the Catholic church and its allies is making headway with a powerfully appealing claim: that when conscience and government policy collide, conscience must prevail.
docs.abstract: Catholic hospitals are now claiming a special right to conscience that trumps law.
docs.snippet: Catholic hospitals are now claiming a special right to conscience that trumps law.
